For the second year in a row ECUs Army ROTC Pirate Battalion brought home a win from the Ranger Challenge PERIOD

Held the weekend of October  at Fort Pickett V.A. the Ranger Challenge is a twoday competition between  schools from North Carolina and Virginia PERIOD

According to team captain Matthew Kane the team was chosen from the  cadets in the ROTC program at ECU PERIOD Cadets are able to tryout for the team and must train five days a week starting in August PERIOD After a month and a half of tryouts the selection is dwindled down to about  people and the final cut is made two weeks before the challenge PERIOD Each team consists of nine males and one female along with two alternates PERIOD

 Kane said PERIOD 

The teams were divided into the Black and Gold divisions based on school size PERIOD ECU was a part of the Black Division which is comprised of larger schools and took first place in its division and overall PERIOD

The first day of the challenge consisted of the Army Physical Fitness Test APFT the written land navigation test and the night land navigation test PERIOD

The APFT is comprised of two minutes of pushups two minutes of situps and a twomile run PERIOD ECU took second place in this event PERIOD

The navigation tests require the teams to navigate themselves to a number of different points PERIOD Using only a compass they must find these points using eight digit coordinates that they plot on a map PERIOD ECU took first place in the written land navigation test PERIOD

On the second day of the challenge the teams competed in the one rope bridge challenge the basic rifle marksmanship challenge the grenade assault course the squad tactical exercise the day land navigation test and the 10K ruck march PERIOD

 Kane said PERIOD

The Ranger Challenge is a great way for cadets to build leadership skills and improve their commission status according to members of the team PERIOD

 said Ranger Challenge team member Ted Brennis PERIOD 

ECUs ROTC cadets went into the challenge in hopes of dominating the competition PERIOD

 said Eric Fitzgerald Ranger Challenge cocaptain PERIOD

ECUs Army ROTC Pirate Battalion will also be participating in the First Annual Wounded Warrior 10K and  Mile Road Race  to benefit the Fort Bragg Wounded Warrior Program PERIOD

The races will be held Saturday Nov PERIOD  at  a.m PERIOD and start behind the Food Lion off of Red Banks Road PERIOD

Registration is  and awards will be given out to various age groups PERIOD

Questions can be directed to Kip Sloan at kip.sloan  ecrun.org  PERIOD
